metadata.feature_description: Provides integration points for social modules like Answers, Blogs, and Discussions.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Community Settings for Social Module Integration

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Community in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Community settings page loads with social module configuration options
steps.actual: Community settings page loaded successfully showing Influence metrics and Miscellaneous Community Settings

steps.action: View social module checkboxes for Content Moderation, Comment Moderation, and Enable WYSIWYG
steps.expected: Checkboxes for Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events, and Wiki should be visible
steps.actual: All social module checkboxes are visible: Content Moderation (Answers, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events checked), Comment Moderation (Blogs, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events, Wiki available), Enable WYSIWYG (Answers, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events checked)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Activity Stream Integration on Community Page

steps.expected: Activity stream with social module activity types should be visible
steps.actual: Community page loaded with Activity Stream showing filter dropdown containing social module activity types: Blogs, Wiki, Questions, Answers, Ideas, Events, Challenges, etc.

steps.action: Verify activity stream shows social content
steps.expected: Social activities should be displayed in the activity stream
steps.actual: Activity stream showed badge activity: 'Content Editor received the badge Getting started' along with Top Contributors section and Activity Stream Filter options

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify PersonaBar Menu Items for Social Features

steps.expected: Settings menu should contain Community and Gamification options related to social features
steps.actual: Settings menu displayed Community and Gamification menu items which provide social module integration configuration

observations: The UI location 'Admin > PersonaBar > Social Features' mentioned in the test spec does not exist as a dedicated menu item. Social module integration is provided through Settings > Community instead.
Code analysis confirms KnownSocialModules list includes: Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events, Wiki, and Challenges (EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs lines 30-39).
The FindFirstSocialModuleOnPage() method detects social modules on the current page and passes this info via the 'socialModule' configuration setting to PersonaBar.
Social module integration works at two levels: (1) Configuration through Community Settings, and (2) Runtime detection of social modules on pages.
The Evoq Engage trial version has social modules (Activity Stream, Badges, Top Contributors) functioning on the Community page.
